Articles.Content:
KSP fails to recognize some of my joystick buttons. I can't even bind them on the input settings page.

There seems to be a pattern, in that KSP only supports the first 20 buttons of any joystick, and doesn't support designated POV Hat Switches:

On my Thrustmaster HOTAS Warthog joystick, which has 19 buttons plus a POV Hat Switch, all the buttons are recognized except for the entire POV Hat Switch.

On my Thrustmaster HOTAS Warthog throttle, which has 32 buttons plus a POV Hat Switch, buttons 0-19 are recognized, but 20-31 and the entire POV Hat Switch aren't.

In addition, I have two homebrew input panels based on generic controller chips from CodeMercenaries (USB Vendor ID 0x07C0):

On an axis input/switch panel based on the JoyWarrior 24A8L (USB Product ID 0x1117), which supports up to 16 buttons, I've only wired two buttons (0 and 1), and they are both recognized. (The axes work fine, too.)

On a switch panel based on the JoyWarrior G32 (USB Product ID 0x1101), which supports up to 32 buttons, I've wired 18 buttons in a non-contiguous fashion; those wired as buttons 5, 7-13, 15 and 18-19 are recognized, whereas those wired as buttons 20-21, 25-28 and 30 aren't.

I'd really appreciate this to be fixed. I want to avoid using the Thrustmaster mapping software, and I have no workaround for my homebrew switchboard.

OS: Windows 7

KSP Version: 1.0.4

I don't think this can be fixed, sorry, the Unity engine has a limit of 20 controller buttons and this cannot be worked around, and many controllers have been broken in recent Unity versions.

Please see the post here for a workaround for controller binding issues.
